comments:
Target Eclipse, latest CVS code as of 20020607

1. Create a new Java launch config. Make the config a favorite.
2. Change the project name to something invalid (for example, add "Bar" to 
the end of the project name).
3. Select something else in the launch config selection area (either 
another config or a config type) and choose "Yes" when prompted to save. At 
this point, you should have the config saved with an error condition.
4. From the debug button chevron, select the config to launch it. The 
following is written to the log. Note that this is the same exception, 
written 4 times:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.launching 4 107 Jun 07, 2002 07:57:42.918
!MESSAGE Launch configuration Hello references non-existing project 
HelloBar.

When I launched a config referencing a non-existing project via the history, I 
got one exception logged, and an error dilaog. When I opened the launch 
dilalog, another exception was logged. Each time I accessed a tab that requried 
the project, an exception was logged.

Do not intend to fix for 2.0 - nothing harmful here.

Fixed. The source lookup tab and classpath tabs have been fixed to set an error 
message rather than log the error. The debug ui plugin has been changed to no 
longer log errors when #errorDialg(..) is called. If an exception needs to be 
logged, #log(..) needs to be called explicitly.
*** Bug 18098 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 19298 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
